negotiator.parties

Interface NegotiationParty

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Mediator
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractNegotiationParty, AbstractTimeDependentNegotiationParty, AcceptingNegotiationParty, Annealer, BoulwareNegotiationParty, ConcederNegotiationParty, ConsensusVotingHumanAgent, CounterOfferHumanNegotiationParty, EnumeratorParty, FeedbackHillClimber, FeedbackMediator, HillClimber, MediatorHumanNegotiationParty, NegotiationEndingParty, NonDeterministicConcederNegotiationParty, RandomCounterOfferNegotiationParty, RandomFiftyFiftyNegotiationParty, RandomFlippingMediator, TimeoutNegotiationParty, TracerParty, UINegotiationParty

    public interface NegotiationParty
    Base interface for Negotiation parties. All parties must minimally implement this interface. This can be used for bilateral as well as multilateral negotiations.
    All time that NegotiationPartys spend in their code, including the time spent in their constructor and init calls, is subtracting from the total available time.

    IMPORTANT

    Implementors of this class must have a public no-argument constructor. In fact we recommend not to implement any constructor at all. Initialization will be done through #init(UtilitySpace, Deadline, Timeline, long).

    history

    NegotiationParty replaces Agent . If you are using a protocol that inherits from MultilateralProtocol you should also use NegotiationParty and not Agent .
    Author:
    David Festen, W.Pasman 21jul15

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init(UtilitySpace utilSpace,
        Deadline deadline,
        TimeLineInfo timeline,
        long randomSeed,
        AgentID agentID)
        This is the first call made to a NegotiationParty after its instantiation. Tells which utility space and timeline we are running in. This is called one time only.
        Parameters:
        utilSpace - (a copy of/readonly version of) the UtilitySpace to be used for this session.
        timeline - The TimeLineInfo about current session.
        agentID - the AgentID.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if init fails.

      • chooseAction

        Action chooseAction(java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends Action>> possibleActions)
        When this function is called, it is expected that the Party chooses one of the actions from the possible action list and returns an instance of the chosen action.
        Parameters:
        possibleActions - List of all actions possible.
        Returns:
        The chosen Action.

      • receiveMessage

        void receiveMessage(java.lang.Object sender,
                  Action arguments)
        This method is called when another NegotiationParty chose an Action.
        Parameters:
        sender - The initiator of the action
        arguments - The action performed

      • getDescription

        java.lang.String getDescription()
        Returns:
        a human-readable description for this party

      • getProtocol

        java.lang.Class<? extends MultilateralProtocol> getProtocol()
        Get the protocol that this party supports.
        Returns:
        the actual supported MultilateralProtocol, usually StackedAlternatingOffersProtocol.
